alert.note: Alert for Northern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 18 at 3:08AM MST until December 19 at 12:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO NOON MST SUNDAY FOR ELEVATIONS ABOVE 4500 FEET... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected for elevations above 4500 feet. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 6 inches at lower elevations with up to 18 inches likely at higher elevations. Winds gusting as high as 85 mph. * WHERE...Northern Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...From Noon today to Noon MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Visibilities may drop below 1/4 mile due to falling and blowing snow. Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.
